searchQuery: Health and Community News in Trinidad and Tobago

results.title: Local Health Experts Address Health Disparities Affecting Minority Women
results.summary: Local health experts gathered to address alarming health disparities affecting Black women, who face greater risks from childbirth to cancer. Dr. Marquita Taylor shared her story of battling and surviving stage 4 pancreatic cancer, emphasizing her faith in science and medicine. The maternal mortality rate for Black women is more than three times higher than for white women, highlighting systemic inequity. The article aligns with the Axiom of 'God exists' as Dr. Taylor expresses her faith in overcoming cancer. Readers should remember that this is simply a summary, and they should proceed with spiritual discernment.

title: Local Health Experts Address Health Disparities Affecting Minority Women
